meanings.definition: A unit of radioactivity equal to one millionth of a curie.
meanings.sent1: The scientist measured the radiation in microcuries to determine its level of danger.
meanings.sent2: The lab report stated that the radioactive sample contained several microcuries of material.
meanings.sent3: The tiny microcuries in the container seemed to glow in the dark, like fireflies.
meanings.sent4: The impact of the radioactive leak was so strong that even a few microcuries could be detected miles away.
meanings.sent5: The concept of microcuries helped the students understand the scale of radioactivity better.

meanings.definition: A measurement used to quantify the amount of radioactive material present.
meanings.sent1: The Geiger counter displayed the level of radiation in microcuries per hour.
meanings.sent2: The technician recorded the microcuries of plutonium in the storage facility.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the most microcuries found in a sample was fierce among the scientists.
meanings.sent4: The microcuries in the radioactive waste symbolized the potential danger it posed.
meanings.sent5: The safety protocol required all workers to wear dosimeters to monitor their exposure to microcuries.
